Phenotype categories

Andri M. Stefansson andri@genuitysci.com

2021-04-27

Source: vignettes/phenotype-categories.Rmd
phenotype-categories.Rmd

In this example, we’re going to explore the capabilities of the phenotype-services using the gorr package.

Load packages

First load the gorr package, the tidyverse package is recommended in general, but not required for this example

library(gorr)
library(magrittr) # pipe
library(tibble)

Connecting to the phenotype service

First we’ll need to establish a connection to our phenotype-catalog API. To do that we’ll need to call phenotype_connect and provide it with the relevant parameters pointing to the phenotype-catalog-service, i.e. api_key and project:

conn <- phenotype_connect(api_key = Sys.getenv("GOR_API_KEY"),
                          project = Sys.getenv("GOR_API_PROJECT"))
conn
#> ── GOR query service connection ────────────────────────────── Version: 3.4.0 ──
#> ● Service Root: https://platform.wuxinextcodedev.com/api/phenotype-catalog
#> ● Build Date: 2021-04-21 09:36:19 +0000
#> ● Commit: 29456d27
#> ● Project: ukbb_hg38
#> ● API key issued at: 2021-03-25 18:42:08
#> ● API key expires at: Never
#> ● Access token issued at: 2021-04-27 12:33:28
#> ● Access token expires at: 2021-04-27 13:33:28

alternative way is to use the gor_connect and pass the relevant api-endpoint

## Dont run
conn <- gor_connect(api_key = Sys.getenv("GOR_API_KEY"),
                    project = Sys.getenv("GOR_API_PROJECT"),
                    api_endpoint = "api/phenotype-catalog")

If everything goes as planned, we’ll have a conn object to pass into subsequent functions.

List categories

All available categories can be listed by passing the conn object to the get_categories function

categories <- get_categories(conn)
categories
#> [1] "congenital anomalies"    "infectious diseases"    
#> [3] "pregnancy complications" "rtestcat19"

The results come back as a vector of categories

Create category

If we want to add a new category to the catalog we can do so using create_category along with the name of the category to be added as follows.

NB: Before creating a new category, make sure you have the privileges (admin rights to category management) to do so.

name <- paste0("rtestcat", sample(1:99, 1)) # Name of new category
new_category <- create_category(name,  conn)

A new category has now been added and assigned to the variable new_category:

print(new_category)
#> $name
#> [1] "rtestcat46"

Delete category

Categories can be removed from project by passing the name of the category to category_delete along with the connector object.

get_categories(conn)
print(name) # Category to be deleted
category_delete(name, conn)
get_categories(conn)
#> [1] "congenital anomalies"    "infectious diseases"    
#> [3] "pregnancy complications" "rtestcat19"             
#> [5] "rtestcat46"
#> [1] "rtestcat46"
#> Response [https://platform.wuxinextcodedev.com/api/phenotype-catalog/projects/ukbb_hg38/categories/rtestcat46]
#>   Date: 2021-04-27 12:33
#>   Status: 204
#>   Content-Type: <unknown>
#> <EMPTY BODY>
#> [1] "congenital anomalies"    "infectious diseases"    
#> [3] "pregnancy complications" "rtestcat19"
